Test Description: Create 1 host network on non-multizone cluster without specifying any label for selecting nodes. Delete the host network and check whether VNICs are released.
Expected Behaviour: All nodes should allocate one VNIC for host network

Test Description: Create 1 host network on Multizone cluster without specifying any label for selecting nodes. Delete the host network and check whether VNICs are released.
Expected Behaviour: All nodes should allocate one VNIC for host network

Test Description: Create multiple host network on non-multizone cluster without specifying any label for selecting nodes. Delete the host network and check whether VNICs are released.
Expected Behaviour: All nodes should allocate one VNIC for host network

Test Description: Create multiple host network on Multizone cluster without specifying any label for selecting nodes. Delete the host network and check whether VNICs are released.
Expected Behaviour: All nodes should allocate one VNIC for host network

Test Description: Create 1 host network on non-multizone cluster with "--selectors" for selecting nodes. Delete the host network and check whether VNICs are released.
Expected Behaviour: Selected nodes should allocate one VNIC for host network

Test Description: Create 1 host network on Multizone cluster with "--selectors" for selecting nodes. Delete the host network and check whether VNICs are released.
Expected Behaviour: Selected nodes should allocate one VNIC for host network

Test Description: Create multiple host network on non-multizone cluster with "--selectors" for selecting nodes. Delete the host network and check whether VNICs are released.
Expected Behaviour: Selected nodes should allocate one VNIC for host network

Test Description: Create multiple host network on Multizone cluster with "--selectors" label for selecting nodes. Delete the host network and check whether VNICs are released.
Expected Behaviour: Selected nodes should allocate one VNIC for host network

Test Description: Create 1 host network on non-multizone cluster and check for data transfer.
Expected Behaviour: TX/Rx bytes count should increase for that interface in ifconfig.

Test Description: Create 1 host network on Multizone cluster and check for data transfer.
Expected Behaviour: TX/Rx bytes count should increase for that interface in ifconfig.

Test Description: Create multiple host network on non-multizone cluster and check for data transfer.
Expected Behaviour: TX/Rx bytes count should increase only for the interface on which pod is running. Other Host network interfaces values should not increase

Test Description: Create multiple host network on Multizone cluster and check for data transfer.
Expected Behaviour: TX/Rx bytes count should increase only for the interface on which pod is running. Other Host network interfaces values should not increase

Test Description: Create multiple host network on non-multizone cluster and check for data transfer. Reboot one node and check the route table for all host network .
Expected Behaviour: TX/Rx bytes count should increase only for the interface on which pod is running. Other Host network interfaces values should not increase. Route table should show route entries for all the host networks.

Test Description: Create multiple host network on Multizone cluster and check for data transfer. Reboot one node and check the route table for all host network .
Expected Behaviour: TX/Rx bytes count should increase only for the interface on which pod is running. Other Host network interfaces values should not increase. Route table should show route entries for all the host networks.

Test Description:
Create host network
Reboot Master node
When node comes back check host-endpoint is exists and data goes through

Create host network
Reboot Non master node
When node comes back check host-endpoint is exists and data goes through

Create host network
Reboot Master and Non master node
When node comes back check host-endpoint is exists and data goes through
Change existing network to host network using "network update" and check data transfer on single zone cluster
Change existing network to host network using "network update" and check data transfer on Multi zone cluster'

Naveen: The data transfer TCs should test clusterIP, NFS and iSCSI as well (priority in that order). For clusterIP cases, if we pick a standard Helm chart in a multizone cluster with default and host-network configured, then the forwarding should work on the data-network using the Host VF. And it should continue to work if the app behind the service moves from one zone to another. clusterIP will get tested at customer site so is very important.
Expected Behaviour: Tested Data transfer with clusterIP (iperf) NFS and iSCSI

Test Description: Naveen: You can configure a perf-tier associated with the host-network VF. So the QOS cases should also be tested in this case.
Expected Behaviour: Checked relative performance numbers for high and medium QoS.

Test Description:
1. Create two host network blue and default
2. Create nfs client pod with blue network and check whether its traffic is flowing through respective interface. Check if blue network's ref count is 1 ( or increased by 1) 
Ref count can be seen in json output of hostnetwork.
3. Delete the nfs client pod ( which is using blue network). And check its ref count is 0 ( or decreased by 1). 
4. Create another nfs client pod with 'default' network. Check if network's ref count is 1 ( or increase by 1) and check whether traffic is flowing through respective interface.
5. Delete the blue network. 
6. Delete the nfs pod ( which is using 'default' network) And check if its ref count is 0 ( or decresed by 1)   
7. Delete default network.

Create Host Network
Check if endpoints on all nodes got created and attached
Add node to the cluster
endpoint should get created on new node

Create Host Network 
Delete one endpoint of the host network from one of the nodes of cluster
Add node to the cluster
endpoint should get created on new node

Create Host Network 
Delete all endpoints of the host network
Add node to the cluster
endpoint should get created on new node
Expected Behaviour: Yet to confirm behavior of this tc with rahul
